name.value: FHIR Connectathon 15 - Patient - Formal Testing - FHIR Server - All Base Operations - Client Assigned Resource Id - XML

description.value: Patient Track - Formal Testing - tests FHIR Server using the XML format to register (create), read, update, retrieve history, version read, search and delete a Patient resource instance where the server assigns the resource id.
Patient create, read, update, delete, history-instance, version read and search-type operations
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure the patient does not exist on the server.
Create a new patient, no extensions where the client assigns the resource id using XML. The expected response content is the created Patient resource in XML format.
Create patient with server assigned resource id.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK) or 201(Created).
Confirm that the returned format is the FHIR XML format.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return the updated resource.
Read the created patient by the known patient resource id in order to save the current version id.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is the FHIR XML format.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
Validate that the returned resource conforms to the base FHIR Patient profile.
Confirm that the resource version is present. This is needed for the test step 05-VersionReadPatient.
Test the update operation with XML content. The Patient birth date is updated to define the 2nd version of this resource. The expected response content is the updated Patient resource in XML format.
Patient update operation with XML content. The response asserts for all the optional HTTP Headers will be warning only.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return the updated resource.
Test the read operation with XML content. The expected response content is the updated Patient resource in XML format.
Read the updated Patient and verify the contents match the updated version.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
Confirm that the returned Patient conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient identifier element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient family name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient given name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient retained gender element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient updated birthDate element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Test the history operation with XML content. The expected response content is a history Bundle resource containing all versions of the Patient resource in XML format.
Retrieve the history Bundle for the Patient instance and verify the first entry is last updated version.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that the returned Bundle conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned Bundle type is history.
Confirm that the returned history Bundle contains at least 2 entries (greater than 1).
Confirm that the Bundle total value matches or is greater than the number of entries in the Bundle. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient meta versionId element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient identifier element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient family name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient given name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient retained gender element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient updated birthDate element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Test the version Read (vread) operation with XML content. The expected response content is the created (first) version of the Patient resource in XML format.
Version Read (vread) the created (first) version of the Patient and verify the contents match the created version.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
Confirm that the returned Patient conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected created Patient meta versionId element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient identifier element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient family name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient given name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected Patient retained gender element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected created Patient birthDate element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.

Test the search operation with XML content. The expected response content is a searchset Bundle resource where the first (and only entry) is the most recent updated version of the Patient resource in XML format.
Search for the Patient and verify the search results contain the most recent updated version of the patient.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that the returned Bundle conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned Bundle type is searchset.
Confirm that the returned searchset Bundle contains 1 entry. Warning only to allow for unlikely but possible other matches.
Confirm that the Bundle total value matches or is greater than the number of entries in the Bundle. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient meta versionId element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient identifier element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient family name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient given name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient retained gender element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned Bundle resource first entry contains the expected Patient updated birthDate element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.

Test the delete operation of the Patient resource with XML formatting. The expected response is 200 (Ok) if a response payload is returned or 204 (No Content) with an empty response payload. A subsequent read operation is executed with an expected response of 410 (Gone)
Delete the Patient and verify that the response code is 200 (Ok) or 204 (No Content).
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK) or 204(No Content).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
Read deleted patient resource with an expected response of gone or not found
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 404(Not Found) or 410(Gone).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only for servers that do not support versioning.
